title: (x) Stencil font used for artist Fabrice Gygi - Cargo {Yves}
content:
Hi everyone,

i have seen posters with this lovely stencil font all over Stockholm, so i had a look in the usual places but couldn’t find a match...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629152635im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gygi_plugg_5611.jpg)

any help is appreciated.

Seb

 [‹ (x) square sans in Karen Cheng’s book "Designing Type" - student work {Paul}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629152635/http:/typophile.com/node/19578 "Go to previous forum topic") [Nintendo Wii ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629152635/http:/typophile.com/node/19584 "Go to next forum topic")
author: all about seb

comments.content: [Another sighting](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629152635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18864) of [Cargo](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629152635/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php?id_categorie=2&id_font=1) by [Gilles Gavillet](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629152635/http:/typophile.com/wiki/%2520Gilles%2520Gavillet), available from the Swiss type studio [Optimo](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629152635/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/index.php). It sure is a refreshing take on the stencil type model.
Thank you Yves for the ID - yes i really enjoy the smoothness of the A, R & Y.
